raw_text:
OutKast win at MTV Europe Awards
 
 US hip-hop duo OutKast have capped a year of award glory with three prizes at the MTV Europe Music Awards in Rome.
 
 They won best group, best video and best song for hit Hey Ya! after getting five nominations. R&B singer Usher won best male and best album for Confessions, while UK rock band Muse were named best alternative act and best British artists. OutKast will add their awards to the four they won at the US MTV Awards in August and three Grammys in February. Not only was Hey Ya! one of the biggest global hits of last year, but OutKast have been widely acclaimed as one of the most exciting and innovative acts in music. Their double CD album Speakerboxxx/The Love Below, which saw Andre 3000 and Big Boi each produce one disc, was hailed as the album of 2003 by many critics.
 
 Andre 3000 thanked fans "for supporting OutKast throughout the years". "We really appreciate it," he said. "I hope you don't get tired of us, but we only do what we do." Also competing for best group had been the Beastie Boys, the Black Eyed Peas, D12 and Maroon 5. And Anastacia, Britney Spears, Maroon 5 and Ludacris had been on the shortlist for best song.
 
 OutKast did lose out in the contest for best album - which was won by Usher, another award favourite. Usher, who performed a duet with Alicia Keys, also beat off competition from Justin Timberlake, Jay-Z, Nelly and Robbie Williams to take the best male crown. He had four nominations going into the ceremony, with seven artists nominated in three categories.
 
 Eminem's group, D12, were surprise winners in the best hip-hop category, beating the Beastie Boys, Jay-Z, Kanye West and Nelly. Eminem told the crowd: "D12 finally won an award, thank you very much." The rapper opened the show with a performance of his songs Like Toy Soldiers and Just Lose It, for which he was joined on stage by a crowd of children. The Black Eyed Peas - who had a global hit with Where is the Love? - picked up the prize for best pop act, beating Anastacia, Avril Lavigne, Robbie Williams and Britney Spears. Spears was named best female, sending a message of thanks on video saying the award "means so much to me". Alicia Keys, Anastasia, Avril Lavigne and Beyonce Knowles had featured alongside her in that contest.
 
 Linkin Park singer Chester Bennington described their prize for best rock band as "quite an honour" while Muse said their win for best alternative act was "a real surprise for us". Muse were also named best UK and Ireland act, ahead of Franz Ferdinand, Natasha Bedingfield, Jamelia and The Streets. Referring to the fact that winners of 11 of the 12 main awards were from the US, Muse singer Matt Bellamy said: "There needs to be more European bands." The 11th annual awards were hosted by hip-hop artist Xzibit and watched by 6,000 people at the Tor Di Valle arena, plus millions more on TV around the world. The ceremony featured performances from the Beastie Boys, who entered the stage on bicycles and skateboards, No Doubt singer Gwen Stefani being lowered from a giant clock and Nelly doing a duet with Pharrell Williams. MTV also organised a huge open-air concert featuring Anastacia and The Cure outside the Italian capital's ancient Colosseum, with some estimates putting the attendance there at 200,000. Last year's big winner at the MTV Europe Awards, held in Edinburgh, Scotland, was Justin Timberlake, who walked away with three trophies.
llama3.2:1b: OutKast won awards at the MTV Europe Music Awards including best group, video, and song for Hey Ya!. They also won best male and album for Confessions, while Usher won best male artist and album for Confessions. Other winners included Muse for best alternative act and British artists, and Maroon 5 for best pop act.
llama3.2:3b: OutKast won three awards at the MTV Europe Music Awards: best group, best video for "Hey Ya!", and best song. Usher took home two awards, including best male artist and best album. Other winners included Muse as best alternative act and best British artists, Eminem's D12 in the best hip-hop category, and Britney Spears for best female.
gemma2:2b: OutKast won best group, best video, and best song for "Hey Ya!" at the MTV Europe Music Awards. Usher won best male and album, while Muse were named best alternative act and British artists. D12 won best hip-hop, and The Black Eyed Peas won best pop act. Linkin Park's Chester Bennington and Muse described their wins as honors, expressing surprise and hope for more European bands at future awards.
qwen2.5:0.5b: OutKast, a US hip-hop duo that won a record-breaking four awards at the MTV Europe Music Awards in Rome last month, has become one of the biggest and most innovative acts in music history. They received five nominations for "Hey Ya!" as Best Group, Best Video, and Best Song, which topped their list of winners at the US MTV Awards in August. OutKast will add their three wins to their four before they are featured on the MTV European Album during the summer. The group has also been praised by critics for their album "Speakerboxxx/The Love Below", a double CD that saw Andre 3000 and Big Boi each contributing one disc, as well as the successful single "Confessions". The group was also highly anticipated for their win at the MTV European Album Awards. Some competitors at the awards included Usher (best male), Confessions (best album), UK rock band Muse (best alternative act), and the R&B singer Usher. OutKast's song "Hey Ya!" had become one of the biggest hits of 2013, with over five million copies sold.
qwen2.5:1.5b: OutKast wins three awards at the MTV Europe Music Awards for their hit song Hey Ya! and collaboration album Speakerboxxx/The Love Below. Britney Spears is named best female artist, while Eminem's D12 group takes hip-hop award honors. The ceremony features performances by artists such as the Beastie Boys on bicycles and Gwen Stefani lowered from a giant clock.
qwen2.5:3b: OutKast won best group, best video and best song (for Hey Ya!) at the MTV Europe Music Awards in Rome, adding to their four US MTV Awards and three Grammy wins. The duo's success is attributed to their acclaimed album Speakerboxxx/The Love Below, which was named album of 2003 by critics. Usher took home awards for best male and best album (Confessions). Muse won best alternative act and best British artists. OutKast thanked fans for supporting them throughout the years, stating they only do what they do. D12 from Eminem's group was a surprise winner in the best hip-hop category. The Black Eyed Peas won best pop act while Britney Spears was named best female. Muse were top winners at this year's MTV Europe Awards and highlighted that 11 of 12 main awards went to US artists, suggesting there needs to be more European winners.
opencoder:1.5b:
OutKast has won the MTV Europe Music Award, with three awards for best group, video, and song.

They have won the album, named as "Speakerboxxx/The Love Below", which saw Andre 3,000 and Big Boi each produce one disc. They also won a double CD album in 2003, acclaimed by critics.

Usher did win the contest for best male album with Confessions. They also have won the best British artists for their double CD album. They have also won a Grammy for the album in August and three in February.

OutKast has been widely appreciated as one of the most exciting and innovative acts in music. Their single CD album was hailed as the album of 2003 by many critics, referring to its popularity over the years.

Alicia Keys, who played on the stage with D12, won an award for best female band. Nelly, who had a global hit with Where is the Love?, also won the prize for best pop act. They have also won the best UK and Ireland band.

Referring to the fact that winners of 11 of the 12 main awards were from the US, they are celebrated for their winnings. The ceremony featured performances by a crowd of children on bicycles and skateboards, while Xzibit hosted the huge open-air concert featuring Anastacia and The Cure outside the city's ancient Colosseum.
smollm:1.7b: OutKast win at MTV Europe Music Awards

OutKast's double CD album Speakerboxxx/The Love Below, which featured producers 3000 (Andre 3000) and Boi-1da, was hailed as one of the most innovative and exciting acts in music, winning the award for best alternative artist. Also competing for best group were the Beastie Boys, Black Eyed Peas, D12, Maroon 5, and Ludacris, but OutKast beat out competition from Justin Timberlakke, Jay-Z, Nellie, Robbie Williams, and Toni Braxton. The ceremony also featured performances by hip-hop artist Xzibit and No Doubt singer Gwen Stefani, as well as an open-air concert featuring outfits from the ancient Roman city of Colosseum.
